00058 #if (defined MRFI_CC2500)
00059 
00060  #define MRFI_RSSI_OFFSET    72   /* no units */
00061 
00062  /* Worst case wait period in RX state before RSSI becomes valid.
00063   * These numbers are from Design Note DN505 with added safety margin.
00064   */
00065   #define MRFI_RSSI_VALID_DELAY_US    1000
00066 
00067 #elif (defined MRFI_CC1100)
00068 
00069   #define MRFI_RSSI_OFFSET    79   /* no units */
00070 
00071  /* Worst case wait period in RX state before RSSI becomes valid.
00072   * These numbers are from Design Note DN505 with added safety margin.
00073   */
00074   #define MRFI_RSSI_VALID_DELAY_US    1300
00075 
00076 #elif (defined MRFI_CC1101) || (defined MRFI_CC1100E_470) || (defined MRFI_CC1100E_950)
00077 
00078   #define MRFI_RSSI_OFFSET    74   /* no units */
00079 
00080  /* Worst case wait period in RX state before RSSI becomes valid.
00081   * These numbers are from Design Note DN505 with added safety margin.
00082   */
00083   #define MRFI_RSSI_VALID_DELAY_US    1300
00084 
00085 #else
00086   #error "ERROR: RSSI offset value not defined for this radio"
00087 #endif
00088

00090 #define MRFI_LENGTH_FIELD_OFS               __mrfi_LENGTH_FIELD_OFS__
00091 #define MRFI_LENGTH_FIELD_SIZE              __mrfi_LENGTH_FIELD_SIZE__
00092 #define MRFI_HEADER_SIZE                    __mrfi_HEADER_SIZE__
00093 #define MRFI_FRAME_BODY_OFS                 __mrfi_DST_ADDR_OFS__
00094 #define MRFI_BACKOFF_PERIOD_USECS           __mrfi_BACKOFF_PERIOD_USECS__
00095 
00096 #define MRFI_RANDOM_OFFSET                   67
00097 #define MRFI_RANDOM_MULTIPLIER              109
00098 #define MRFI_MIN_SMPL_FRAME_SIZE            (MRFI_HEADER_SIZE + NWK_HDR_SIZE)
00099 
00100 /* rx metrics definitions, known as appended "packet status bytes" in datasheet parlance */
00101 #define MRFI_RX_METRICS_CRC_OK_MASK         __mrfi_RX_METRICS_CRC_OK_MASK__
00102 #define MRFI_RX_METRICS_LQI_MASK            __mrfi_RX_METRICS_LQI_MASK__

00104 /* GDO functionality */
00105 #define MRFI_GDO_SYNC           6
00106 #define MRFI_GDO_CCA            9
00107 #define MRFI_GDO_PA_PD          27  /* low when transmit is active, low during sleep */
00108 #define MRFI_GDO_LNA_PD         28  /* low when receive is active, low during sleep */
00109 
00110 /* ---------- Radio Abstraction ---------- */
00111 #if (defined MRFI_CC1100)
00112 #define MRFI_RADIO_PARTNUM          0x00
00113 #define MRFI_RADIO_MIN_VERSION      3
00114 
00115 #elif (defined MRFI_CC1101)
00116 #define MRFI_RADIO_PARTNUM          0x00
00117 #define MRFI_RADIO_MIN_VERSION      4
00118 
00119 #elif (defined MRFI_CC1100E_470)
00120 #define MRFI_RADIO_PARTNUM          0x00
00121 #define MRFI_RADIO_MIN_VERSION      5
00122 
00123 #elif (defined MRFI_CC1100E_950)
00124 #define MRFI_RADIO_PARTNUM          0x00
00125 #define MRFI_RADIO_MIN_VERSION      5
00126 
00127 #elif (defined MRFI_CC2500)
00128 #define MRFI_RADIO_PARTNUM          0x80
00129 #define MRFI_RADIO_MIN_VERSION      3
00130 #else
00131 #error "ERROR: Missing or unrecognized radio."
00132 #endif
00133 
00134 /* GDO0 output pin configuration */
00135 #define MRFI_SETTING_IOCFG0     MRFI_GDO_SYNC
00136 
00137 /* Main Radio Control State Machine control configuration:
00138  * Auto Calibrate - when going from IDLE to RX/TX
00139  * PO_TIMEOUT is extracted from SmartRF setting.
00140  * XOSC is OFF in Sleep state.
00141  */
00142 #define MRFI_SETTING_MCSM0      (0x10 | (SMARTRF_SETTING_MCSM0 & (BV(2)|BV(3))))
00143 
00144 /* Main Radio Control State Machine control configuration:
00145  * - Remain RX state after RX
00146  * - Go to IDLE after TX
00147  * - RSSI below threshold and NOT receiving.
00148  */
00149 #define MRFI_SETTING_MCSM1      0x3C
00150 
00151 /*
00152  *  Packet Length - Setting for maximum allowed packet length.
00153  *  The PKTLEN setting does not include the length field but maximum frame size does.
00154  *  Subtract length field size from maximum frame size to get value for PKTLEN.
00155  */
00156 #define MRFI_SETTING_PKTLEN     (MRFI_MAX_FRAME_SIZE - MRFI_LENGTH_FIELD_SIZE)
00157 
00158 /* Packet automation control - Original value except WHITE_DATA is extracted from SmartRF setting. */
00159 #define MRFI_SETTING_PKTCTRL0   (0x05 | (SMARTRF_SETTING_PKTCTRL0 & BV(6)))
00160 
00161 /* FIFO threshold - this register has fields that need to be configured for the CC1101 */
00162 #define MRFI_SETTING_FIFOTHR    (0x07 | (SMARTRF_SETTING_FIFOTHR & (BV(4)|BV(5)|BV(6))))
00163 
00164 /* Max time we can be in a critical section within the delay function.
00165  * This could be fine-tuned by observing the overhead is calling the bsp delay
00166  * function. The overhead should be very small compared to this value.
00167  * Note that the max value for this must be less than 19 usec with the
00168  * default CLKCON.TICKSPD and CLKCON.CLOCKSPD settings and external 26 MHz
00169  * crystal as a clock source (which we use).
00170  *
00171  * Be careful of direct calls to Mrfi_DelayUsec().
00172  */
00173 #define MRFI_MAX_DELAY_US 16 /* usec */
00174 
00175 #define MRFI_PKTSTATUS_CCA BV(4)
00176 #define MRFI_PKTSTATUS_CS  BV(6)
00177 
00178   /* The SW timer is calibrated by adjusting the call to the microsecond delay
00179    * routine. This allows maximum calibration control with repects to the longer
00180    * times requested by applicationsd and decouples internal from external calls
00181    * to the microsecond routine which can be calibrated independently.
00182    */
00183 #if defined(SW_TIMER)
00184 #define APP_USEC_VALUE    496
00185 #else
00186 #define APP_USEC_VALUE    1000
00187 #endif
00188 
00189 /* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00190  *                                           Macros
00191  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00192  */
00193 #define MRFI_SYNC_PIN_IS_HIGH()                     MRFI_GDO0_PIN_IS_HIGH()
00194 #define MRFI_ENABLE_SYNC_PIN_INT()                  MRFI_ENABLE_GDO0_INT()
00195 #define MRFI_DISABLE_SYNC_PIN_INT()                 MRFI_DISABLE_GDO0_INT()
00196 #define MRFI_SYNC_PIN_INT_IS_ENABLED()              MRFI_GDO0_INT_IS_ENABLED()
00197 #define MRFI_CLEAR_SYNC_PIN_INT_FLAG()              MRFI_CLEAR_GDO0_INT_FLAG()
00198 #define MRFI_SYNC_PIN_INT_FLAG_IS_SET()             MRFI_GDO0_INT_FLAG_IS_SET()
00199 #define MRFI_CONFIG_SYNC_PIN_FALLING_EDGE_INT()     MRFI_CONFIG_GDO0_FALLING_EDGE_INT()
00200 
00201 #define MRFI_PAPD_PIN_IS_HIGH()                     MRFI_SYNC_PIN_IS_HIGH()
00202 #define MRFI_CLEAR_PAPD_PIN_INT_FLAG()              MRFI_CLEAR_SYNC_PIN_INT_FLAG()
00203 #define MRFI_PAPD_INT_FLAG_IS_SET()                 MRFI_SYNC_PIN_INT_FLAG_IS_SET()
00204 #define MRFI_CONFIG_PAPD_FALLING_EDGE_INT()         MRFI_CONFIG_SYNC_PIN_FALLING_EDGE_INT()
00205 
00206 #define MRFI_CONFIG_GDO0_AS_PAPD_SIGNAL()           mrfiSpiWriteReg(IOCFG0, MRFI_GDO_PA_PD)
00207 #define MRFI_CONFIG_GDO0_AS_SYNC_SIGNAL()           mrfiSpiWriteReg(IOCFG0, MRFI_GDO_SYNC)
00208 
00209 
00210 /* There is no bit in h/w to tell if RSSI in the register is valid or not.
00211  * The hardware needs to be in RX state for a certain amount of time before
00212  * a valid RSSI value is calculated and placed in the register. This min
00213  * wait time is defined by MRFI_BOARD_RSSI_VALID_DELAY_US. We don't need to
00214  * add such delay every time RSSI value is needed. If the Carier Sense signal
00215  * is high or CCA signal is high, we know that the RSSI value must be valid.
00216  * We use that knowledge to reduce our wait time. We break down the delay loop
00217  * in multiple chunks and during each iteration, check for the CS and CCA
00218  * signal. If either of these signals is high, we return immediately. Else,
00219  * we wait for the max delay specified.
00220  */
00221 #define MRFI_RSSI_VALID_WAIT()                                                \
00222 {                                                                             \
00223   int16_t delay = MRFI_RSSI_VALID_DELAY_US;                                   \
00224   do                                                                          \
00225   {                                                                           \
00226     if(mrfiSpiReadReg(PKTSTATUS) & (MRFI_PKTSTATUS_CCA | MRFI_PKTSTATUS_CS))  \
00227     {                                                                         \
00228       break;                                                                  \
00229     }                                                                         \
00230     Mrfi_DelayUsec(64); /* sleep */                                           \
00231     delay -= 64;                                                              \
00232   }while(delay > 0);                                                          \
00233 }                                                                             \
00234 
00235 #define MRFI_STROBE_IDLE_AND_WAIT()                   \
00236 {                                                     \
00237   mrfiSpiCmdStrobe( SIDLE );                          \
00238   while (mrfiSpiCmdStrobe( SNOP ) & 0xF0) ;           \
00239 }
00240 
00241 /* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00242  *                                    Local Constants
00243  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00244  */
00245 static const uint8_t mrfiRadioCfg[][2] =
00246 {
00247   /* internal radio configuration */
00248   {  IOCFG0,    MRFI_SETTING_IOCFG0       },
00249   {  MCSM1,     MRFI_SETTING_MCSM1        }, /* CCA mode, RX_OFF_MODE and TX_OFF_MODE */
00250   {  MCSM0,     MRFI_SETTING_MCSM0        }, /* AUTO_CAL and XOSC state in sleep */
00251   {  PKTLEN,    MRFI_SETTING_PKTLEN       },
00252   {  PKTCTRL0,  MRFI_SETTING_PKTCTRL0     },
00253 #ifdef MRFI_CC1101
00254   {  FIFOTHR,   MRFI_SETTING_FIFOTHR      },
00255 #endif
00256 
00257   /* imported SmartRF radio configuration */
00258   {  FSCTRL1,   SMARTRF_SETTING_FSCTRL1   },
00259   {  FSCTRL0,   SMARTRF_SETTING_FSCTRL0   },
00260   {  FREQ2,     SMARTRF_SETTING_FREQ2     },
00261   {  FREQ1,     SMARTRF_SETTING_FREQ1     },
00262   {  FREQ0,     SMARTRF_SETTING_FREQ0     },
00263   {  MDMCFG4,   SMARTRF_SETTING_MDMCFG4   },
00264   {  MDMCFG3,   SMARTRF_SETTING_MDMCFG3   },
00265   {  MDMCFG2,   SMARTRF_SETTING_MDMCFG2   },
00266   {  MDMCFG1,   SMARTRF_SETTING_MDMCFG1   },
00267   {  MDMCFG0,   SMARTRF_SETTING_MDMCFG0   },
00268   {  DEVIATN,   SMARTRF_SETTING_DEVIATN   },
00269   {  FOCCFG,    SMARTRF_SETTING_FOCCFG    },
00270   {  BSCFG,     SMARTRF_SETTING_BSCFG     },
00271   {  AGCCTRL2,  SMARTRF_SETTING_AGCCTRL2  },
00272   {  AGCCTRL1,  SMARTRF_SETTING_AGCCTRL1  },
00273   {  AGCCTRL0,  SMARTRF_SETTING_AGCCTRL0  },
00274   {  FREND1,    SMARTRF_SETTING_FREND1    },
00275   {  FREND0,    SMARTRF_SETTING_FREND0    },
00276   {  FSCAL3,    SMARTRF_SETTING_FSCAL3    },
00277   {  FSCAL2,    SMARTRF_SETTING_FSCAL2    },
00278   {  FSCAL1,    SMARTRF_SETTING_FSCAL1    },
00279   {  FSCAL0,    SMARTRF_SETTING_FSCAL0    },
00280   {  TEST2,     SMARTRF_SETTING_TEST2     },
00281   {  TEST1,     SMARTRF_SETTING_TEST1     },
00282   {  TEST0,     SMARTRF_SETTING_TEST0     },
00283 };

00299 /* ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00300  *                                       Local Variables
00301  * ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00302  */
00303 static uint8_t mrfiRadioState  = MRFI_RADIO_STATE_UNKNOWN;
00304 static mrfiPacket_t mrfiIncomingPacket;
00305 static uint8_t mrfiRndSeed = 0;
00306 
00307 /* reply delay support */
00308 static volatile uint8_t  sKillSem = 0;
00309 static volatile uint8_t  sReplyDelayContext = 0;
00310 static          uint16_t sReplyDelayScalar = 0;
00311 static          uint16_t sBackoffHelper = 0;
00312 
00313 /**************************************************************************************************
00314  * @fn          MRFI_Init
00315  *
00316  * @brief       Initialize MRFI.
00317  *
00318  * @param       none
00319  *
00320  * @return      none
00321  **************************************************************************************************
00322  */
00323 void MRFI_Init(void)
00324 {
00325   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------
00326    *    Initialization
00327    *   -----------------
00328    */
00329 
00330   memset(&mrfiIncomingPacket, 0x0, sizeof(mrfiIncomingPacket));
00331 
00332   /* initialize GPIO pins */
00333   MRFI_CONFIG_GDO0_PIN_AS_INPUT();
00334 
00335   /* initialize SPI */
00336   mrfiSpiInit();
00337 
00338   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------
00339    *    Radio power-up reset
00340    *   ----------------------
00341    */
00342   MRFI_ASSERT(MRFI_SPI_CSN_IS_HIGH());
00343 
00344   /* pulse CSn low then high */
00345   MRFI_SPI_DRIVE_CSN_LOW();
00346   Mrfi_DelayUsec(10);
00347   MRFI_SPI_DRIVE_CSN_HIGH();
00348 
00349   /* hold CSn high for at least 40 microseconds */
00350   Mrfi_DelayUsec(40);
00351 
00352   /* pull CSn low and wait for SO to go low */
00353   MRFI_SPI_DRIVE_CSN_LOW();
00354   while (MRFI_SPI_SO_IS_HIGH());
00355 
00356   /* directly send strobe command - cannot use function as it affects CSn pin */
00357   MRFI_SPI_WRITE_BYTE(SRES);
00358   MRFI_SPI_WAIT_DONE();
00359 
00360   /* wait for SO to go low again, reset is complete at that point */
00361   while (MRFI_SPI_SO_IS_HIGH());
00362 
00363   /* return CSn pin to its default high level */
00364   MRFI_SPI_DRIVE_CSN_HIGH();
00365 
00366   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------
00367    *    Run-time integrity checks
00368    *   ---------------------------
00369    */
00370 
00371   /* verify that SPI is working, PKTLEN is an arbitrary read/write register used for testing */
00372 #ifdef MRFI_ASSERTS_ARE_ON
00373 #define TEST_VALUE 0xA5
00374   mrfiSpiWriteReg( PKTLEN, TEST_VALUE );
00375   MRFI_ASSERT( mrfiSpiReadReg( PKTLEN ) == TEST_VALUE ); /* SPI is not responding */
00376 #endif
00377 
00378   /* verify the correct radio is installed */
00379   MRFI_ASSERT( mrfiSpiReadReg( PARTNUM ) == MRFI_RADIO_PARTNUM );      /* incorrect radio specified */
00380   MRFI_ASSERT( mrfiSpiReadReg( VERSION ) >= MRFI_RADIO_MIN_VERSION );  /* obsolete radio specified  */
00381 
00382   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------
00383    *    Configure radio
00384    *   -----------------
00385    */
00386 
00387   /* initialize radio registers */
00388   {
00389     uint8_t i;
00390 
00391     for (i=0; i<(sizeof(mrfiRadioCfg)/sizeof(mrfiRadioCfg[0])); i++)
00392     {
00393       mrfiSpiWriteReg(mrfiRadioCfg[i][0], mrfiRadioCfg[i][1]);
00394     }
00395   }
00396 
00397   /* Initial radio state is IDLE state */
00398   mrfiRadioState = MRFI_RADIO_STATE_IDLE;
00399 
00400   /* set default channel */
00401   MRFI_SetLogicalChannel( 0 );
00402 
00403   /* set default power */
00404   MRFI_SetRFPwr(MRFI_NUM_POWER_SETTINGS - 1);
00405 
00406   /* Generate Random seed:
00407    * We will use the RSSI value to generate our random seed.
00408    */
00409 
00410   /* Put the radio in RX state */
00411   mrfiSpiCmdStrobe( SRX );
00412 
00413   /* delay for the rssi to be valid */
00414   MRFI_RSSI_VALID_WAIT();
00415 
00416   /* use most random bit of rssi to populate the random seed */
00417   {
00418     uint8_t i;
00419     for(i=0; i<16; i++)
00420     {
00421       mrfiRndSeed = (mrfiRndSeed << 1) | (mrfiSpiReadReg(RSSI) & 0x01);
00422     }
00423   }
00424 
00425   /* Force the seed to be non-zero by setting one bit, just in case... */
00426   mrfiRndSeed |= 0x0080;
00427 
00428   /* Turn off RF. */
00429   Mrfi_RxModeOff();
00430 
00431   /*****************************************************************************************
00432    *                            Compute reply delay scalar
00433    *
00434    * Formula from data sheet for all the narrow band radios is:
00435    *
00436    *                (256 + DATAR_Mantissa) * 2^(DATAR_Exponent)
00437    * DATA_RATE =    ------------------------------------------ * f(xosc)
00438    *                                    2^28
00439    *
00440    * To try and keep some accuracy we change the exponent of the denominator
00441    * to (28 - (exponent from the configuration register)) so we do a division
00442    * by a smaller number. We find the power of 2 by shifting.
00443    *
00444    * The maximum delay needed depends on the MAX_APP_PAYLOAD parameter. Figure
00445    * out how many bits that will be when overhead is included. Bits/bits-per-second
00446    * is seconds to transmit (or receive) the maximum frame. We multiply this number
00447    * by 1000 to find the time in milliseconds. We then additionally multiply by
00448    * 10 so we can add 5 and divide by 10 later, thus rounding up to the number of
00449    * milliseconds. This last won't matter for slow transmissions but for faster ones
00450    * we want to err on the side of being conservative and making sure the radio is on
00451    * to receive the reply. The semaphore monitor will shut it down. The delay adds in
00452    * a platform fudge factor that includes processing time on peer plus lags in Rx and
00453    * processing time on receiver's side. Also includes round trip delays from CCA
00454    * retries. This portion is included in PLATFORM_FACTOR_CONSTANT defined in mrfi.h.
00455    *
00456    * Note that we assume a 26 MHz clock for the radio...
00457    * ***************************************************************************************
00458    */
00459 #define   MRFI_RADIO_OSC_FREQ        26000000
00460 #define   PHY_PREAMBLE_SYNC_BYTES    8
00461 
00462   {
00463     uint32_t dataRate, bits;
00464     uint16_t exponent, mantissa;
00465 
00466     /* mantissa is in MDMCFG3 */
00467     mantissa = 256 + SMARTRF_SETTING_MDMCFG3;
00468 
00469     /* exponent is lower nibble of MDMCFG4. */
00470     exponent = 28 - (SMARTRF_SETTING_MDMCFG4 & 0x0F);
00471 
00472     /* we can now get data rate */
00473     dataRate = mantissa * (MRFI_RADIO_OSC_FREQ>>exponent);
00474 
00475     bits = ((uint32_t)((PHY_PREAMBLE_SYNC_BYTES + MRFI_MAX_FRAME_SIZE)*8))*10000;
00476 
00477     /* processing on the peer + the Tx/Rx time plus more */
00478     sReplyDelayScalar = PLATFORM_FACTOR_CONSTANT + (((bits/dataRate)+5)/10);
00479 
00480     /* This helper value is used to scale the backoffs during CCA. At very
00481      * low data rates we need to backoff longer to prevent continual sampling
00482      * of valid frames which take longer to send at lower rates. Use the scalar
00483      * we just calculated divided by 32. With the backoff algorithm backing
00484      * off up to 16 periods this will result in waiting up to about 1/2 the total
00485      * scalar value. For high data rates this does not contribute at all. Value
00486      * is in microseconds.
00487      */
00488     sBackoffHelper = MRFI_BACKOFF_PERIOD_USECS + (sReplyDelayScalar>>5)*1000;
00489   }
00490 
00491   /* Clean out buffer to protect against spurious frames */
00492   memset(mrfiIncomingPacket.frame, 0x00, sizeof(mrfiIncomingPacket.frame));
00493   memset(mrfiIncomingPacket.rxMetrics, 0x00, sizeof(mrfiIncomingPacket.rxMetrics));
00494 
00495   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------
00496    *    Configure interrupts
00497    *   ----------------------
00498    */
00499 
00500   /*
00501    *  Configure and enable the SYNC signal interrupt.
00502    *
00503    *  This interrupt is used to indicate receive.  The SYNC signal goes
00504    *  high when a receive OR a transmit begins.  It goes high once the
00505    *  sync word is received or transmitted and then goes low again once
00506    *  the packet completes.
00507    */
00508   MRFI_CONFIG_GDO0_AS_SYNC_SIGNAL();
00509   MRFI_CONFIG_SYNC_PIN_FALLING_EDGE_INT();
00510   MRFI_CLEAR_SYNC_PIN_INT_FLAG();
00511 
00512   /* enable global interrupts */
00513   BSP_ENABLE_INTERRUPTS();
00514 }
00515 
00516 
00517 /**************************************************************************************************
00518  * @fn          MRFI_Transmit
00519  *
00520  * @brief       Transmit a packet using CCA algorithm.
00521  *
00522  * @param       pPacket - pointer to packet to transmit
00523  *
00524  * @return      Return code indicates success or failure of transmit:
00525  *                  MRFI_TX_RESULT_SUCCESS - transmit succeeded
00526  *                  MRFI_TX_RESULT_FAILED  - transmit failed because CCA failed
00527  **************************************************************************************************
00528  */
00529 uint8_t MRFI_Transmit(mrfiPacket_t * pPacket, uint8_t txType)
00530 {
00531   uint8_t ccaRetries;
00532   uint8_t txBufLen;
00533   uint8_t returnValue = MRFI_TX_RESULT_SUCCESS;
00534 
00535   /* radio must be awake to transmit */
00536   MRFI_ASSERT( mrfiRadioState != MRFI_RADIO_STATE_OFF );
00537 
00538   /* Turn off reciever. We can ignore/drop incoming packets during transmit. */
00539   Mrfi_RxModeOff();
00540 
00541   /* compute number of bytes to write to transmit FIFO */
00542   txBufLen = pPacket->frame[MRFI_LENGTH_FIELD_OFS] + MRFI_LENGTH_FIELD_SIZE;
00543 
00544   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------
00545    *    Write packet to transmit FIFO
00546    *   --------------------------------
00547    */
00548   mrfiSpiWriteTxFifo(&(pPacket->frame[0]), txBufLen);
00549 
00550 
00551   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------
00552    *    Immediate transmit
00553    *   ---------------------
00554    */
00555   if (txType == MRFI_TX_TYPE_FORCED)
00556   {
00557     /* Issue the TX strobe. */
00558     mrfiSpiCmdStrobe( STX );
00559 
00560     /* Wait for transmit to complete */
00561     while(!MRFI_SYNC_PIN_INT_FLAG_IS_SET());
00562 
00563     /* Clear the interrupt flag */
00564     MRFI_CLEAR_SYNC_PIN_INT_FLAG();
00565   }
00566   else
00567   {
00568     /* ------------------------------------------------------------------
00569      *    CCA transmit
00570      *   ---------------
00571      */
00572 
00573     MRFI_ASSERT( txType == MRFI_TX_TYPE_CCA );
00574 
00575     /* set number of CCA retries */
00576     ccaRetries = MRFI_CCA_RETRIES;
00577 
00578     /* For CCA algorithm, we need to know the transition from the RX state to
00579      * the TX state. There is no need for SYNC signal in this logic. So we
00580      * can re-configure the GDO_0 output from the radio to be PA_PD signal
00581      * instead of the SYNC signal.
00582      * Since both SYNC and PA_PD are used as falling edge interrupts, we
00583      * don't need to reconfigure the MCU input.
00584      */
00585     MRFI_CONFIG_GDO0_AS_PAPD_SIGNAL();
00586 
00587     /* ===============================================================================
00588      *    Main Loop
00589      *  =============
00590      */
00591     for (;;)
00592     {
00593       /* Radio must be in RX mode for CCA to happen.
00594        * Otherwise it will transmit without CCA happening.
00595        */
00596 
00597       /* Can not use the Mrfi_RxModeOn() function here since it turns on the
00598        * Rx interrupt, which we don't want in this case.
00599        */
00600       mrfiSpiCmdStrobe( SRX );
00601 
00602       /* wait for the rssi to be valid. */
00603       MRFI_RSSI_VALID_WAIT();
00604 
00605       /*
00606        *  Clear the PA_PD pin interrupt flag.  This flag, not the interrupt itself,
00607        *  is used to capture the transition that indicates a transmit was started.
00608        *  The pin level cannot be used to indicate transmit success as timing may
00609        *  prevent the transition from being detected.  The interrupt latch captures
00610        *  the event regardless of timing.
00611        */
00612       MRFI_CLEAR_PAPD_PIN_INT_FLAG();
00613 
00614       /* send strobe to initiate transmit */
00615       mrfiSpiCmdStrobe( STX );
00616 
00617       /* Delay long enough for the PA_PD signal to indicate a
00618        * successful transmit. This is the 250 XOSC periods
00619        * (9.6 us for a 26 MHz crystal) See section 19.6 of 2500 datasheet.
00620        * Found out that we need a delay of atleast 20 us on CC2500 and
00621        * 25 us on CC1100 to see the PA_PD signal change.
00622        */
00623       Mrfi_DelayUsec(25);
00624 
00625 
00626       /* PA_PD signal goes from HIGH to LOW when going from RX state.
00627        * This transition is trapped as a falling edge interrupt flag
00628        * to indicate that CCA passed and the transmit has started.
00629        */
00630       if (MRFI_PAPD_INT_FLAG_IS_SET())
00631       {
00632         /* ------------------------------------------------------------------
00633         *    Clear Channel Assessment passed.
00634         *   ----------------------------------
00635         */
00636 
00637         /* Clear the PA_PD int flag */
00638         MRFI_CLEAR_PAPD_PIN_INT_FLAG();
00639 
00640         /* PA_PD signal stays LOW while in TX state and goes back to HIGH when
00641          * the radio transitions to RX state.
00642          */
00643         /* wait for transmit to complete */
00644         while (!MRFI_PAPD_PIN_IS_HIGH());
00645 
00646         /* transmit done, break */
00647         break;
00648       }
00649       else
00650       {
00651         /* ------------------------------------------------------------------
00652          *    Clear Channel Assessment failed.
00653          *   ----------------------------------
00654          */
00655 
00656         /* Turn off radio and save some power during backoff */
00657 
00658         /* NOTE: Can't use Mrfi_RxModeOff() - since it tries to update the
00659          * sync signal status which we are not using during the TX operation.
00660          */
00661         MRFI_STROBE_IDLE_AND_WAIT();
00662 
00663         /* flush the receive FIFO of any residual data */
00664         mrfiSpiCmdStrobe( SFRX );
00665 
00666         /* Retry ? */
00667         if (ccaRetries != 0)
00668         {
00669           /* delay for a random number of backoffs */
00670           Mrfi_RandomBackoffDelay();
00671 
00672           /* decrement CCA retries before loop continues */
00673           ccaRetries--;
00674         }
00675         else /* No CCA retries are left, abort */
00676         {
00677           /* set return value for failed transmit and break */
00678           returnValue = MRFI_TX_RESULT_FAILED;
00679           break;
00680         }
00681       } /* CCA Failed */
00682     } /* CCA loop */
00683   }/* txType is CCA */
00684 
00685   /* Done with TX. Clean up time... */
00686 
00687   /* Radio is already in IDLE state */
00688 
00689   /*
00690    * Flush the transmit FIFO.  It must be flushed so that
00691    * the next transmit can start with a clean slate.
00692    */
00693   mrfiSpiCmdStrobe( SFTX );
00694 
00695   /* Restore GDO_0 to be SYNC signal */
00696   MRFI_CONFIG_GDO0_AS_SYNC_SIGNAL();
00697 
00698   /* If the radio was in RX state when transmit was attempted,
00699    * put it back to Rx On state.
00700    */
00701   if(mrfiRadioState == MRFI_RADIO_STATE_RX)
00702   {
00703     Mrfi_RxModeOn();
00704   }
00705 
00706   return( returnValue );
00707 }
00708 
00709 
00710 /**************************************************************************************************
00711  * @fn          MRFI_Receive
00712  *
00713  * @brief       Copies last packet received to the location specified.
00714  *              This function is meant to be called after the ISR informs
00715  *              higher level code that there is a newly received packet.
00716  *
00717  * @param       pPacket - pointer to location of where to copy received packet
00718  *
00719  * @return      none
00720  **************************************************************************************************
00721  */
00722 void MRFI_Receive(mrfiPacket_t * pPacket)
00723 {
00724   *pPacket = mrfiIncomingPacket;
00725 }
00726 
00727 
00728 /**************************************************************************************************
00729  * @fn          Mrfi_SyncPinRxIsr
00730  *
00731  * @brief       This interrupt is called when the SYNC signal transition from high to low.
00732  *              The sync signal is routed to the sync pin which is a GPIO pin.  This high-to-low
00733  *              transition signifies a receive has completed.  The SYNC signal also goes from
00734  *              high to low when a transmit completes.   This is protected against within the
00735  *              transmit function by disabling sync pin interrupts until transmit completes.
00736  *
00737  * @param       none
00738  *
00739  * @return      none
00740  **************************************************************************************************
00741  */
00742 static void Mrfi_SyncPinRxIsr(void)
00743 {
00744   uint8_t frameLen;
00745   uint8_t rxBytes;
00746 
00747   /* We should receive this interrupt only in RX state
00748    * Should never receive it if RX was turned On only for
00749    * some internal mrfi processing like - during CCA.
00750    * Otherwise something is terribly wrong.
00751    */
00752   MRFI_ASSERT( mrfiRadioState == MRFI_RADIO_STATE_RX );
00753 
00754   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------
00755    *    Get RXBYTES
00756    *   -------------
00757    */
00758 
00759   /*
00760    *  Read the RXBYTES register from the radio.
00761    *  Bit description of RXBYTES register:
00762    *    bit 7     - RXFIFO_OVERFLOW, set if receive overflow occurred
00763    *    bits 6:0  - NUM_BYTES, number of bytes in receive FIFO
00764    *
00765    *  Due a chip bug, the RXBYTES register must read the same value twice
00766    *  in a row to guarantee an accurate value.
00767    */
00768   {
00769     uint8_t rxBytesVerify;
00770 
00771     rxBytesVerify = mrfiSpiReadReg( RXBYTES );
00772 
00773     do
00774     {
00775       rxBytes = rxBytesVerify;
00776       rxBytesVerify = mrfiSpiReadReg( RXBYTES );
00777     }
00778     while (rxBytes != rxBytesVerify);
00779   }
00780 
00781 
00782   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------
00783    *    FIFO empty?
00784    *   -------------
00785    */
00786 
00787   /*
00788    *  See if the receive FIFIO is empty before attempting to read from it.
00789    *  It is possible nothing the FIFO is empty even though the interrupt fired.
00790    *  This can happen if address check is enabled and a non-matching packet is
00791    *  received.  In that case, the radio automatically removes the packet from
00792    *  the FIFO.
00793    */
00794   if (rxBytes == 0)
00795   {
00796     /* receive FIFO is empty - do nothing, skip to end */
00797   }
00798   else
00799   {
00800     /* receive FIFO is not empty, continue processing */
00801 
00802     /* ------------------------------------------------------------------
00803      *    Process frame length
00804      *   ----------------------
00805      */
00806 
00807     /* read the first byte from FIFO - the packet length */
00808     mrfiSpiReadRxFifo(&frameLen, MRFI_LENGTH_FIELD_SIZE);
00809 
00810     /*
00811      *  Make sure that the frame length just read corresponds to number of bytes in the buffer.
00812      *  If these do not match up something is wrong.
00813      *
00814      *  This can happen for several reasons:
00815      *   1) Incoming packet has an incorrect format or is corrupted.
00816      *   2) The receive FIFO overflowed.  Overflow is indicated by the high
00817      *      bit of rxBytes.  This guarantees the value of rxBytes value will not
00818      *      match the number of bytes in the FIFO for overflow condition.
00819      *   3) Interrupts were blocked for an abnormally long time which
00820      *      allowed a following packet to at least start filling the
00821      *      receive FIFO.  In this case, all received and partially received
00822      *      packets will be lost - the packet in the FIFO and the packet coming in.
00823      *      This is the price the user pays if they implement a giant
00824      *      critical section.
00825      *   4) A failed transmit forced radio to IDLE state to flush the transmit FIFO.
00826      *      This could cause an active receive to be cut short.
00827      *
00828      *  Also check the sanity of the length to guard against rogue frames.
00829      */
00830     if ((rxBytes != (frameLen + MRFI_LENGTH_FIELD_SIZE + MRFI_RX_METRICS_SIZE))           ||
00831         ((frameLen + MRFI_LENGTH_FIELD_SIZE) > MRFI_MAX_FRAME_SIZE) ||
00832         (frameLen < MRFI_MIN_SMPL_FRAME_SIZE)
00833        )
00834     {
00835       bspIState_t s;
00836 
00837       /* mismatch between bytes-in-FIFO and frame length */
00838 
00839       /*
00840        *  Flush receive FIFO to reset receive.  Must go to IDLE state to do this.
00841        *  The critical section guarantees a transmit does not occur while cleaning up.
00842        */
00843       BSP_ENTER_CRITICAL_SECTION(s);
00844       MRFI_STROBE_IDLE_AND_WAIT();
00845       mrfiSpiCmdStrobe( SFRX );
00846       mrfiSpiCmdStrobe( SRX );
00847       BSP_EXIT_CRITICAL_SECTION(s);
00848 
00849       /* flush complete, skip to end */
00850     }
00851     else
00852     {
00853       /* bytes-in-FIFO and frame length match up - continue processing */
00854 
00855       /* ------------------------------------------------------------------
00856        *    Get packet
00857        *   ------------
00858        */
00859 
00860       /* clean out buffer to help protect against spurious frames */
00861       memset(mrfiIncomingPacket.frame, 0x00, sizeof(mrfiIncomingPacket.frame));
00862 
00863       /* set length field */
00864       mrfiIncomingPacket.frame[MRFI_LENGTH_FIELD_OFS] = frameLen;
00865 
00866       /* get packet from FIFO */
00867       mrfiSpiReadRxFifo(&(mrfiIncomingPacket.frame[MRFI_FRAME_BODY_OFS]), frameLen);
00868 
00869       /* get receive metrics from FIFO */
00870       mrfiSpiReadRxFifo(&(mrfiIncomingPacket.rxMetrics[0]), MRFI_RX_METRICS_SIZE);
00871 
00872 
00873       /* ------------------------------------------------------------------
00874        *    CRC check
00875        *   ------------
00876        */
00877 
00878       /*
00879        *  Note!  Automatic CRC check is not, and must not, be enabled.  This feature
00880        *  flushes the *entire* receive FIFO when CRC fails.  If this feature is
00881        *  enabled it is possible to be reading from the FIFO and have a second
00882        *  receive occur that fails CRC and automatically flushes the receive FIFO.
00883        *  This could cause reads from an empty receive FIFO which puts the radio
00884        *  into an undefined state.
00885        */
00886 
00887       /* determine if CRC failed */
00888       if (!(mrfiIncomingPacket.rxMetrics[MRFI_RX_METRICS_CRC_LQI_OFS] & MRFI_RX_METRICS_CRC_OK_MASK))
00889       {
00890         /* CRC failed - do nothing, skip to end */
00891       }
00892       else
00893       {
00894         /* CRC passed - continue processing */
00895 
00896         /* ------------------------------------------------------------------
00897          *    Filtering
00898          *   -----------
00899          */
00900 
00901         /* if address is not filtered, receive is successful */
00902         if (!MRFI_RxAddrIsFiltered(MRFI_P_DST_ADDR(&mrfiIncomingPacket)))
00903         {
00904           {
00905             /* ------------------------------------------------------------------
00906              *    Receive successful
00907              *   --------------------
00908              */
00909 
00910             /* Convert the raw RSSI value and do offset compensation for this radio */
00911             mrfiIncomingPacket.rxMetrics[MRFI_RX_METRICS_RSSI_OFS] =
00912                 Mrfi_CalculateRssi(mrfiIncomingPacket.rxMetrics[MRFI_RX_METRICS_RSSI_OFS]);
00913 
00914             /* Remove the CRC valid bit from the LQI byte */
00915             mrfiIncomingPacket.rxMetrics[MRFI_RX_METRICS_CRC_LQI_OFS] =
00916               (mrfiIncomingPacket.rxMetrics[MRFI_RX_METRICS_CRC_LQI_OFS] & MRFI_RX_METRICS_LQI_MASK);
00917 
00918 
00919             /* call external, higher level "receive complete" processing routine */
00920             MRFI_RxCompleteISR();
00921           }
00922         }
00923       }
00924     }
00925   }
00926 
00927   /* ------------------------------------------------------------------
00928    *    End of function
00929    *   -------------------
00930    */
00931 }
00932 
00933 /**************************************************************************************************
00934  * @fn          Mrfi_RxModeOn
00935  *
00936  * @brief       Put radio into receive mode.
00937  *
00938  * @param       none
00939  *
00940  * @return      none
00941  **************************************************************************************************
00942  */
00943 static void Mrfi_RxModeOn(void)
00944 {
00945   /* clear any residual receive interrupt */
00946   MRFI_CLEAR_SYNC_PIN_INT_FLAG();
00947 
00948   /* send strobe to enter receive mode */
00949   mrfiSpiCmdStrobe( SRX );
00950 
00951   /* enable receive interrupts */
00952   MRFI_ENABLE_SYNC_PIN_INT();
00953 }
00954 
00955 /**************************************************************************************************
00956  * @fn          MRFI_RxOn
00957  *
00958  * @brief       Turn on the receiver.  No harm is done if this function is called when
00959  *              receiver is already on.
00960  *
00961  * @param       none
00962  *
00963  * @return      none
00964  **************************************************************************************************
00965  */
00966 void MRFI_RxOn(void)
00967 {
00968   /* radio must be awake before we can move it to RX state */
00969   MRFI_ASSERT( mrfiRadioState != MRFI_RADIO_STATE_OFF );
00970 
00971   /* if radio is off, turn it on */
00972   if(mrfiRadioState != MRFI_RADIO_STATE_RX)
00973   {
00974     mrfiRadioState = MRFI_RADIO_STATE_RX;
00975     Mrfi_RxModeOn();
00976   }
00977 }
00978 
00979 /**************************************************************************************************
00980  * @fn          Mrfi_RxModeOff
00981  *
00982  * @brief       -
00983  *
00984  * @param       none
00985  *
00986  * @return      none
00987  **************************************************************************************************
00988  */
00989 static void Mrfi_RxModeOff(void)
00990 {
00991   /*disable receive interrupts */
00992   MRFI_DISABLE_SYNC_PIN_INT();
00993 
00994   /* turn off radio */
00995   MRFI_STROBE_IDLE_AND_WAIT();
00996 
00997   /* flush the receive FIFO of any residual data */
00998   mrfiSpiCmdStrobe( SFRX );
00999 
01000   /* clear receive interrupt */
01001   MRFI_CLEAR_SYNC_PIN_INT_FLAG();
01002 }
01003 
01004 
01005 /**************************************************************************************************
01006  * @fn          MRFI_RxIdle
01007  *
01008  * @brief       Put radio in idle mode (receiver if off).  No harm is done this function is
01009  *              called when radio is already idle.
01010  *
01011  * @param       none
01012  *
01013  * @return      none
01014  **************************************************************************************************
01015  */
01016 void MRFI_RxIdle(void)
01017 {
01018   /* radio must be awake to move it to idle mode */
01019   MRFI_ASSERT( mrfiRadioState != MRFI_RADIO_STATE_OFF );
01020 
01021   /* if radio is on, turn it off */
01022   if(mrfiRadioState == MRFI_RADIO_STATE_RX)
01023   {
01024     Mrfi_RxModeOff();
01025     mrfiRadioState = MRFI_RADIO_STATE_IDLE;
01026   }
01027 }
01028 
01029 
01030 /**************************************************************************************************
01031  * @fn          MRFI_Sleep
01032  *
01033  * @brief       Request radio go to sleep.
01034  *
01035  * @param       none
01036  *
01037  * @return      none
01038  **************************************************************************************************
01039  */
01040 void MRFI_Sleep(void)
01041 {
01042   bspIState_t s;
01043 
01044   /* Critical section necessary for watertight testing and
01045    * setting of state variables.
01046    */
01047   BSP_ENTER_CRITICAL_SECTION(s);
01048 
01049   /* If radio is not asleep, put it to sleep */
01050   if(mrfiRadioState != MRFI_RADIO_STATE_OFF)
01051   {
01052     /* go to idle so radio is in a known state before sleeping */
01053     MRFI_RxIdle();
01054 
01055     mrfiSpiCmdStrobe( SPWD );
01056 
01057     /* Our new state is OFF */
01058     mrfiRadioState = MRFI_RADIO_STATE_OFF;
01059   }
01060 
01061   BSP_EXIT_CRITICAL_SECTION(s);
01062 }
01063 
01064 
01065 /**************************************************************************************************
01066  * @fn          MRFI_WakeUp
01067  *
01068  * @brief       Wake up radio from sleep state.
01069  *
01070  * @param       none
01071  *
01072  * @return      none
01073  **************************************************************************************************
01074  */
01075 void MRFI_WakeUp(void)
01076 {
01077   /* if radio is already awake, just ignore wakeup request */
01078   if(mrfiRadioState != MRFI_RADIO_STATE_OFF)
01079   {
01080     return;
01081   }
01082 
01083   /* drive CSn low to initiate wakeup */
01084   MRFI_SPI_DRIVE_CSN_LOW();
01085 
01086   /* wait for MISO to go high indicating the oscillator is stable */
01087   while (MRFI_SPI_SO_IS_HIGH());
01088 
01089   /* wakeup is complete, drive CSn high and continue */
01090   MRFI_SPI_DRIVE_CSN_HIGH();
01091 
01092 /*
01093  *  The test registers must be restored after sleep for the CC1100 and CC2500 radios.
01094  *  This is not required for the CC1101 radio.
01095  */
01096 #ifndef MRFI_CC1101
01097   mrfiSpiWriteReg( TEST2, SMARTRF_SETTING_TEST2 );
01098   mrfiSpiWriteReg( TEST1, SMARTRF_SETTING_TEST1 );
01099   mrfiSpiWriteReg( TEST0, SMARTRF_SETTING_TEST0 );
01100 #endif
01101 
01102   /* enter idle mode */
01103   mrfiRadioState = MRFI_RADIO_STATE_IDLE;
01104   MRFI_STROBE_IDLE_AND_WAIT();
01105 }
01106 
01107 
01108 /**************************************************************************************************
01109  * @fn          MRFI_GpioIsr
01110  *
01111  * @brief       Interrupt Service Routine for handling GPIO interrupts.  The sync pin interrupt
01112  *              comes in through GPIO.  This function is designed to be compatible with "ganged"
01113  *              interrupts.  If the GPIO interrupt services more than just a single pin (very
01114  *              common), this function just needs to be called from the higher level interrupt
01115  *              service routine.
01116  *
01117  * @param       none
01118  *
01119  * @return      none
01120  **************************************************************************************************
01121  */
01122 void MRFI_GpioIsr(void)
01123 {
01124   /* see if sync pin interrupt is enabled and has fired */
01125   if (MRFI_SYNC_PIN_INT_IS_ENABLED() && MRFI_SYNC_PIN_INT_FLAG_IS_SET())
01126   {
01127     /*  clear the sync pin interrupt, run sync pin ISR */
01128 
01129     /*
01130      *  NOTE!  The following macro clears the interrupt flag but it also *must*
01131      *  reset the interrupt capture.  In other words, if a second interrupt
01132      *  occurs after the flag is cleared it must be processed, i.e. this interrupt
01133      *  exits then immediately starts again.  Most microcontrollers handle this
01134      *  naturally but it must be verified for every target.
01135      */
01136     MRFI_CLEAR_SYNC_PIN_INT_FLAG();
01137     Mrfi_SyncPinRxIsr();
01138   }
01139 }
01140 
01141 
01142 /**************************************************************************************************
01143  * @fn          MRFI_Rssi
01144  *
01145  * @brief       Returns "live" RSSI value
01146  *
01147  * @param       none
01148  *
01149  * @return      RSSI value in units of dBm.
01150  **************************************************************************************************
01151  */
01152 int8_t MRFI_Rssi(void)
01153 {
01154   uint8_t regValue;
01155 
01156   /* Radio must be in RX state to measure rssi. */
01157   MRFI_ASSERT( mrfiRadioState == MRFI_RADIO_STATE_RX );
01158 
01159   /* Wait for the RSSI to be valid:
01160    * Just having the Radio ON is not enough to read
01161    * the correct RSSI value. The Radio must in RX mode for
01162    * a certain duration. This duration depends on
01163    * the baud rate and the received signal strength itself.
01164    */
01165   MRFI_RSSI_VALID_WAIT();
01166 
01167   /* Read the RSSI value */
01168   regValue = mrfiSpiReadReg( RSSI );
01169 
01170   /* convert and do offset compensation */
01171   return( Mrfi_CalculateRssi(regValue) );
01172 }
01173 
01174 
01175 /**************************************************************************************************
01176  * @fn          Mrfi_CalculateRssi
01177  *
01178  * @brief       Does binary to decimal conversiont and offset compensation.
01179  *
01180  * @param       none
01181  *
01182  * @return      RSSI value in units of dBm.
01183  **************************************************************************************************
01184  */
01185 int8_t Mrfi_CalculateRssi(uint8_t rawValue)
01186 {
01187   int16_t rssi;
01188 
01189   /* The raw value is in 2's complement and in half db steps. Convert it to
01190    * decimal taking into account the offset value.
01191    */
01192   if(rawValue >= 128)
01193   {
01194     rssi = (int16_t)(rawValue - 256)/2 - MRFI_RSSI_OFFSET;
01195   }
01196   else
01197   {
01198     rssi = (rawValue/2) - MRFI_RSSI_OFFSET;
01199   }
01200 
01201   /* Restrict this value to least value can be held in an 8 bit signed int */
01202   if(rssi < -128)
01203   {
01204     rssi = -128;
01205   }
01206 
01207   return rssi;
01208 }
01209 
01210 /**************************************************************************************************
01211  * @fn          MRFI_RandomByte
01212  *
01213  * @brief       Returns a random byte. This is a pseudo-random number generator.
01214  *              The generated sequence will repeat every 256 values.
01215  *              The sequence itself depends on the initial seed value.
01216  *
01217  * @param       none
01218  *
01219  * @return      a random byte
01220  **************************************************************************************************
01221  */
01222 uint8_t MRFI_RandomByte(void)
01223 {
01224   mrfiRndSeed = (mrfiRndSeed*MRFI_RANDOM_MULTIPLIER) + MRFI_RANDOM_OFFSET;
01225 
01226   return mrfiRndSeed;
01227 }
01228 
01229 /**************************************************************************************************
01230  * @fn          Mrfi_RandomBackoffDelay
01231  *
01232  * @brief       -
01233  *
01234  * @param       none
01235  *
01236  * @return      none
01237  **************************************************************************************************
01238  */
01239 static void Mrfi_RandomBackoffDelay(void)
01240 {
01241   uint8_t backoffs;
01242   uint8_t i;
01243 
01244   /* calculate random value for backoffs - 1 to 16 */
01245   backoffs = (MRFI_RandomByte() & 0x0F) + 1;
01246 
01247   /* delay for randomly computed number of backoff periods */
01248   for (i=0; i<backoffs; i++)
01249   {
01250     Mrfi_DelayUsec( sBackoffHelper );
01251   }
01252 }
01253 
01254 /****************************************************************************************************
01255  * @fn          Mrfi_DelayUsec
01256  *
01257  * @brief       Execute a delay loop using HW timer. The macro actually used to do the delay
01258  *              is not thread-safe. This routine makes the delay execution thread-safe by breaking
01259  *              up the requested delay up into small chunks and executing each chunk as a critical
01260  *              section. The chunk size is choosen to be the smallest value used by MRFI. The delay
01261  *              is only approximate because of the overhead computations. It errs on the side of
01262  *              being too long.
01263  *
01264  * input parameters
01265  * @param   howLong - number of microseconds to delay
01266  *
01267  * @return      none
01268  ****************************************************************************************************
01269  */
01270 static void Mrfi_DelayUsec(uint16_t howLong)
01271 {
01272   bspIState_t s;
01273   uint16_t count = howLong/MRFI_MAX_DELAY_US;
01274 
01275   if (howLong)
01276   {
01277     do
01278     {
01279       BSP_ENTER_CRITICAL_SECTION(s);
01280       BSP_DELAY_USECS(MRFI_MAX_DELAY_US);
01281       BSP_EXIT_CRITICAL_SECTION(s);
01282     } while (count--);
01283   }
01284 
01285   return;
01286 }
01287 
01288 /****************************************************************************************************
01289  * @fn          Mrfi_DelayUsecSem
01290  *
01291  * @brief       Execute a delay loop using a HW timer. See comments for Mrfi_DelayUsec().
01292  *              Delay specified number of microseconds checking semaphore for
01293  *              early-out. Run in a separate thread when the reply delay is
01294  *              invoked. Cleaner then trying to make MRFI_DelayUsec() thread-safe
01295  *              and reentrant.
01296  *
01297  * input parameters
01298  * @param   howLong - number of microseconds to delay
01299  *
01300  * @return      none
01301  ****************************************************************************************************
01302  */
01303 static void Mrfi_DelayUsecSem(uint16_t howLong)
01304 {
01305   bspIState_t s;
01306   uint16_t count = howLong/MRFI_MAX_DELAY_US;
01307 
01308   if (howLong)
01309   {
01310     do
01311     {
01312       BSP_ENTER_CRITICAL_SECTION(s);
01313       BSP_DELAY_USECS(MRFI_MAX_DELAY_US);
01314       BSP_EXIT_CRITICAL_SECTION(s);
01315       if (sKillSem)
01316       {
01317         break;
01318       }
01319     } while (count--);
01320   }
01321 
01322   return;
01323 }
01324 
01325 /**************************************************************************************************
01326  * @fn          MRFI_DelayMs
01327  *
01328  * @brief       Delay the specified number of milliseconds.
01329  *
01330  * @param       milliseconds - delay time
01331  *
01332  * @return      none
01333  **************************************************************************************************
01334  */
01335 void MRFI_DelayMs(uint16_t milliseconds)
01336 {
01337   while (milliseconds)
01338   {
01339     Mrfi_DelayUsec( APP_USEC_VALUE );
01340     milliseconds--;
01341   }
01342 }
01343 
01344 /**************************************************************************************************
01345  * @fn          MRFI_ReplyDelay
01346  *
01347  * @brief       Delay number of milliseconds scaled by data rate. Check semaphore for
01348  *              early-out. Run in a separate thread when the reply delay is
01349  *              invoked. Cleaner then trying to make MRFI_DelayMs() thread-safe
01350  *              and reentrant.
01351  *
01352  * @param       none
01353  *
01354  * @return      none
01355  **************************************************************************************************
01356  */
01357 void MRFI_ReplyDelay()
01358 {
01359   bspIState_t s;
01360   uint16_t    milliseconds = sReplyDelayScalar;
01361 
01362   BSP_ENTER_CRITICAL_SECTION(s);
01363   sReplyDelayContext = 1;
01364   BSP_EXIT_CRITICAL_SECTION(s);
01365 
01366   while (milliseconds)
01367   {
01368     Mrfi_DelayUsecSem( APP_USEC_VALUE );
01369     if (sKillSem)
01370     {
01371       break;
01372     }
01373     milliseconds--;
01374   }
01375 
01376   BSP_ENTER_CRITICAL_SECTION(s);
01377   sKillSem           = 0;
01378   sReplyDelayContext = 0;
01379   BSP_EXIT_CRITICAL_SECTION(s);
01380 }
01381 
01382 /**************************************************************************************************
01383  * @fn          MRFI_PostKillSem
01384  *
01385  * @brief       Post to the loop-kill semaphore that will be checked by the iteration loops
01386  *              that control the delay thread.
01387  *
01388  * @param       none
01389  *
01390  * @return      none
01391  **************************************************************************************************
01392  */
01393 void MRFI_PostKillSem(void)
01394 {
01395 
01396   if (sReplyDelayContext)
01397   {
01398     sKillSem = 1;
01399   }
01400 
01401   return;
01402 }
01403 
01404 /**************************************************************************************************
01405  * @fn          MRFI_GetRadioState
01406  *
01407  * @brief       Returns the current radio state.
01408  *
01409  * @param       none
01410  *
01411  * @return      radio state - off/idle/rx
01412  **************************************************************************************************
01413  */
01414 uint8_t MRFI_GetRadioState(void)
01415 {
01416   return mrfiRadioState;
01417 }
01418 
01419 /**************************************************************************************************
01420  *                                  Compile Time Integrity Checks
01421  **************************************************************************************************
01422  */
01423 
01424 
01425 #define MRFI_RADIO_TX_FIFO_SIZE     64  /* from datasheet */
01426 
01427 /* verify largest possible packet fits within FIFO buffer */
01428 #if ((MRFI_MAX_FRAME_SIZE + MRFI_RX_METRICS_SIZE) > MRFI_RADIO_TX_FIFO_SIZE)
01429 #error "ERROR:  Maximum possible packet length exceeds FIFO buffer.  Decrease value of maximum application payload."
01430 #endif
01431 
01432 /* verify that the SmartRF file supplied is compatible */
01433 #if ((!defined SMARTRF_RADIO_CC2500) && \
01434      (!defined SMARTRF_RADIO_CC1100) && \
01435      (!defined SMARTRF_RADIO_CC1101) && \
01436      (!defined SMARTRF_RADIO_CC1100E))
01437 #error "ERROR:  The SmartRF export file is not compatible."
01438 #endif
01439 
01440 /*
01441  *  These asserts happen if there is extraneous compiler padding of arrays.
01442  *  Modify compiler settings for no padding, or, if that is not possible,
01443  *  comment out the offending asserts.
01444  */
01445 BSP_STATIC_ASSERT(sizeof(mrfiRadioCfg) == ((sizeof(mrfiRadioCfg)/sizeof(mrfiRadioCfg[0])) * sizeof(mrfiRadioCfg[0])));
01446 
01447

01449 */
